dialogue: Cousin.
Cousin.
Erzsebet is alive.
What did you say?
I have a letter from her - your Erzsebet is alive and she is with little Zsofia. LASZLO lets out a deep emotional wail and holds his blood relative tight in his arms.
It's a combination of things. Most popular is the cabinetry which we do ourselves, custom-to-order. The lamps too. Some pieces we've found and restored. Audrey does the displays.
He speaks like an American from the television now-
That's all I need.
For the employee restroom, you just exit the front door, and walk around back where I parked the car. There's a staircase there, it takes you up to our apartment. If you need anything just knock.
Is it smaller than you expected?
What?
The shop.
No, not at all. I had no expectation.
Who is Miller?
I am Miller.
You are Molnar.
Not anymore.
No Miller, No Sons.
Folks here like a family business-
So, what do you think?
Of the furniture?
Well, I meant of everything so far - Philadelphia - but sure the pieces on the floor also...
That's what you're here for, Maestro.
Next month, I can put you on the payroll. You're welcome to eat with us upstairs on Sundays.
You and your wife have done quite enough.
Don't mention it.
No, I do mention- thank you, Attila.
Gentile?
She's Catholic.
We are Catholic.
Erzsebet...
They pay you well?
On the last job, they paid okay. They took on a lot of pieces though. Kept adding to the order. Even at a discount, it adds up...
His old man got flush adapting production techniques to expedite the manufacturing of cargo ships during the war.
Christ, is this guy trying to shake us? Does he think he's in a drag race? Come on, already!
To be finished on Thursday, we need extra hands. Including materials and glass, eight hundred dollars.
Dance with us! Come on! Cut a rug.
No, thank you.
Don't be a spoiled-sport!
I'm not sure what that is but no thank you.
The track comes to an end.
Flip it for the other side-
You should have seen him talking up the price today! I was ready to settle at 450.
I wasn't doing that. I was just telling him how much it will cost.
I thought he was about to blow it for us!
I did! I honestly did! I thought you were going to completely blow it but you held your ground. That's what makes you a professional.
Hopefully, it's not only that-
You know, Laszlo's bride was a goy, too, when they met, but she converted for him-
All in the same direction?
The long panels, yes. The shelves themselves, however, can vary in height to accommodate the larger volumes our client had been stacking on the floor.
Everyone all right down there?
We have a piece of gutter to replace now, as well!
Laszlo is a licensed architect. He supervised the renovation. And I- I've done business with your son before. I have a furniture shop, Miller and Son's, down in Kensington.
May I show you around the space, sir? Our work lamps aren't doing the work we've done here any justice.
Wake up.
That's a hell of a way to greet the day.
Harry Lee called.
He says he won't pay.
For the materials?
He says we damaged the property and I'm lucky if he doesn't take me to court.
You've got nothing to say to that? What are you going to do about it?
I take you into my home. Into my place of business, Laszlo, and this is how you thank me?
You run my clients out the door? You make a pass at my wife? She told me! Of course, she told me. What did you expect?
Silence.

Hell, what did I expect? You couldn't keep your hands to yourself even when we were kids. Listen up, I won't tell Erzsi this time. I know you've been through a lot. That's what I told Audrey, too. I'm not going to hurt you, but I can't help you anymore either, got it?
Gordon-
